citation.article-title: Flavobacterium banpakuense sp. nov., isolated from leaf-and-branch compost
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium banpakuense sp. nov.

Flavobacterium banpakuense [ban.pa.ku.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. banpakuense of or belonging to banpaku, the short name of ‘Bankoku Hakurankai Koen’ (the Japanese name of EXPO Park), where the type strain was isolated].
Cells are Gram-stain-negative rods, 0.4–0.8 µm in diameter and 1.6–3.2 µm in length, motile by gliding, strictly aerobic, chemoheterotrophic, catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
Spores are not formed.
Colonies on LB gellan gum are circular with entire margins, convex, smooth, slightly raised and yellow-pigmented.
Congo red is not absorbed by colonies.
Flexirubin-type pigments are produced.
Growth occurs on LB gellan gum at 10–34 °C (optimum, 30 °C), at pH 6–8 (optimum, pH 7) and in the presence of 0–1.5 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 1 %).
Weak growth occurs at 4 °C, but no growth occurs at 37 °C.
No growth occurs in 2 % (w/v) NaCl.
Grows on LB agar, NA, TSA and R2A agar at 30 °C.
Colonies on R2A agar show irregular spreading shapes.
Skim milk, CM-cellulose and starch are degraded, but not agar, chitin, tributyrin or filter paper.

In the API 20NE strip: nitrate is reduced to nitrogen; indole is produced; glucose is not fermented; β-galactosidase activity is present; arginine dihydrolase and urease activities are absent; aesculin and gelatin are hydrolysed; and glucose, arabinose, mannose, N-acetylglucosamine and maltose are assimilated, but mannitol, gluconate, caprate, adipate, malate, citrate and phenylacetate are not.

In the API ZYM strip, alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities are present, but esterase (C4), lipase (C14), α-galactosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activities are absent.
Weak activities are observed for esterase lipase (C8), cystine arylamidase and β-glucuronidase.
The predominant cellular fatty acids (>10 % of the total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0 and summed feature 3 (comprising C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH).
The major isoprenoid quinone is MK-6.
The type strain is 15F3T ( = KACC 14225T = JCM 16466T), isolated from leaf-and-branch compost at EXPO Park, Osaka, Japan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 31.1 mol% (HPLC).
